title: I'd love a rioter to read this.
body:
I was just placed in a que with a player I've never played with before who is hellbent on trolling me, claiming that if nobody dodges "we will lose". He locked in a troll pick of Veigar jungle in a ranked game then proceeded to troll in the chat and claim our jungler stole his role. Fortunately it was a remake... However, I really doubt anything will be done? 

I of course reported the player but is pre game chat even taken into account here? I only managed to get a couple of screenshots unfortunately but the intent is quite obviously clear.

https://gyazo.com/34b46a2708792afa2d102111e5f0508b
https://gyazo.com/18a63bfdd8855dc333101b51b47132a9

replies.body:
Yeah so this behaviour is really bad, I think that stands by itself. As for your question on reports; pre-game chat is [recorded](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/lo1oZ0Pm-champ-select-reporting?comment=000000030000) and you can be punished for breaking the rules there just like you can in-game. The current recommendation though is that you report them normally, but leave a short description note outlining that this person was toxic in pre-game chat.

If you forgot to leave a short description note that's fine, just send [Riot Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) a quick report request with the evidence you provided here. Make sure you use the _"I want to report abusive behavior, cheating, or a malicious link"_ category.

Best of luck :)
Just letting you know that sending it to Riot Support doesn't work. They just tell you they're not going to do anything and to use the IFS.

It's normal for them to ask you to remember to use the Instant Feedback System in the future since it's more efficient. But this the first I've heard that they're telling people they're not doing anything with reports. The report category is there after all, so they should be taking these reports seriously.

Do you have a ticket ID, post, or screenshot of that message? I'd love to follow up with a few people and see what happened there.

https://imgur.com/a/vZ0Kd

I provided screenshots of the chats as well as giving timestamps for other areas in chat that I didn't manage to screenshot. I also mentioned that I also used IFS, but sent a ticket to make sure.

The Rioter basically said "death threats aren't allowed, I can't act on tickets, use IFS".

That text you underlined is a bit weird, I'll ask around and see what that's about. Although it does make sense that they didn't act on this case since report had already gone through the Instant Feedback System. 

Remember it's not like you get a harsher punishment or faster escalation because you sent it to Riot. They still have to abide by the same rules the Instant Feedback System has. So if the IFS had already dealt with it, there's no benefit to it being dealt with again.

Well, using the IFS, death threats are instant bannable. However the player in question is still playing on the account, even though he used flagged words/phrases, got reported with IFS, *and* got reported in a ticket.

Since Riot refused to do anything based on a ticket and the flagging system is automated, everything rested on the IFS, which clearly hasn't worked.

>That text you underlined is a bit weird

Weirdly honest is all.

Yeah it's pretty disappointing, especially if someone is posting irrefutable evidence and essentially doing all the work for them. People that are this toxic and will literally ruin the game for 4 other people over some stupid vendetta such as having an "int list" really don't belong in this community. 

I'm disappointed to hear nothing is done about these sorts of things.
the only thing that seems to get you banned now is being toxic

I mean, i've submitted several reports on players who i report post game as well as to support, i just get a blanket response

"please use instant feedback"
